feed.title: Category: where did that come from? | geoMusings

entry.title: Today We Are All Hokies...
entry.content:
Hokie Nation has invited everyone to wear their school colors today as a show of solidarity. I will. You should, too. I work with a lot of VT grads. I have seen that their lifelong identification with VT rivals that of Notre Dame alumni.

So, from this Retreiver to all of Hokie Nation: My prayers are with you.

Bill Dollins University of Maryland Baltimore County (UMBC) '92

entry.title: Outta Here...
entry.content:
I'm off with the family for a week of sun, sand and frothy umbrella drinks.

I've spent the last couple of days working on a WCF web service wrapping some PostGIS calls. I hope to be able to write about it not long after I get back. I'm also continuing with the ArcCatalog objects for zigGIS but work has had this funny way of intruding lately.

See you later...

entry.title: Happy New Year and a Continued Merry Christmas
entry.content:
Greetings to all and wishes for a peaceful and prosperous 2007. And, for those of you keeping track at home, today would be "seven swans a-swimming".

I'm heading out for a business trip tomorrow that keeps me gone for the rest of the week so it's time to pack away the decorations. Typically, we wait until after Three King's Day but my travel schedule won't allow for that this year.
